me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.util

Class STBUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.util.STBUtil

  • public class STBUtil
extends Object
    A collection of miscellaneous utility methods.

        public static boolean isInteractive(Material mat)

        Parameters:
        mat - the material to check
        Returns:
        true if the material is interactive; false otherwise

      • isColorable

        public static boolean isColorable(Material mat)
        Check if the given material is colourable. Ideally the relevant MaterialData should implement the Colorable interface, but Bukkit doesn't have that yet...
        Parameters:
        mat - the material to check
        Returns:
        true if the material is colourable; false otherwise

      • isObtainable

        public static boolean isObtainable(Material mat)
        Check if the given material is obtainable - if false, then even silk touch won't help.
        Parameters:
        mat - the material to check
        Returns:
        true if the material can be obtained normally (including with silk touch)

                 String name,
                 Player player)
        Create a skull with the given player skin
        Parameters:
        b - block in which to create the skull
        name - name of the skin
        player - skull will face the opposite direction the player faces
        Returns:
        the skull (the caller should call skull.update() when ready)

        Returns:

      • getFaceFromYaw

        public static BlockFace getFaceFromYaw(float yaw)
        Given a yaw value, get the closest block face for the given yaw. The yaw value is usually obtained via Location.getYaw()
        Parameters:
        yaw - the yaw to convert
        Returns:
        the nearest block face

      • calculateDrops

        public static List<ItemStack> calculateDrops(Block b,
                             ItemStack tool)
        Get the drops which the given block could produce, given the tool used to break it, taking into account any silk touch or looting enchantment on the tool as well as the type of tool. For blocks which can drop a random number of items, this method may return a different result each time it's called.
        Parameters:
        b - the block
        tool - the tool, may be null for an empty hand
        Returns:
        a list of items which would drop from the block, if broken

      • isExposed

        public static boolean isExposed(Block block,
                BlockFace face)
        Check if the given block is exposed to the world on the given face. Material.isOccluding() is used to check if a face is exposed.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to check
        face - the face to check
        Returns:
        true if the given block face is exposed

      • isExposed

        public static boolean isExposed(Block block)
        Check if the given block is exposed on any face. Material.isOccluding() is used to check if a face is exposed.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to check
        Returns:
        true if any face of the block is exposed

        Parameters:
        ch - the chargeable item or block
        Returns:
        a formatted string showing the chargeable's charge

        Parameters:
        stack - the item stack
        Returns:
        a formatted description of the item stack

        Parameters:

        colour - the colour
        Returns:
        the material data object

      • forceInventoryRefresh

        public static void forceInventoryRefresh(Inventory inv)
        Workaround method: ensure that the given inventory is refreshed to all its viewers. This is needed in some cases to avoid ghost items being left around (in particular if an item is shift-clicked into a machine inventory and then shortly after moved to a different slot).
        Parameters:
        inv - the inventory to refresh

      • makeStack

        public static ItemStack makeStack(Material material,
                  String title,
                  String... lore)
        Convenience method to create an item stack with defined title and lore data
        Parameters:
        material - the material to create the stack from
        title - the item's title, may be null
        lore - the item's lore, may be empty
        Returns:
        a new ItemStack with the given title and lore

      • makeStack

                  String title,
                  String... lore)

        Parameters:

        title - the item's title, may be null
        lore - the item's lore, may be empty
        Returns:
        a new ItemStack with the given title and lore

        Returns:

      • isInfiniteWaterSource

        public static boolean isInfiniteWaterSource(Block block)
        Check if the given block is an infinite water source. It must be a non-flowing source water block with at least 2 non-flowing source water block neighbours.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to check
        Returns:
        true if the block is an infinite water source

      • makeWildCardMaterialData

        public static MaterialData makeWildCardMaterialData(BaseSTBItem item)
        Get a special material data for the item with the data set to -1. This is useful when using the item in recipes, as a "don't care" data value.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to convert
        Returns:
        a MaterialData for the item with wildcarded data

      • makeWildCardMaterialData

        public static MaterialData makeWildCardMaterialData(Material mat)
        Get a special material data for the material with the data set to -1. This is useful when using the item in recipes, as a "don't care" data value.
        Parameters:
        mat - the base material
        Returns:
        a MaterialData for the material with wildcarded data

      • makeWildCardItemStack

        public static ItemStack makeWildCardItemStack(Material mat)
        Get a special item stack for the material with the data set to 32767. This is useful when using the item in recipes, as a "don't care" data value.
        Parameters:
        mat - the base material
        Returns:
        an item stack for the material with wildcarded data

      • giveItems

        public static void giveItems(HumanEntity player,

        Parameters:

        stacks - one or more item stacks

      • dumpItemStack

        public static List<String> dumpItemStack(ItemStack stack)

      • parseMaterialSpec

        public static ItemStack parseMaterialSpec(String spec)
        Given a string specification, try to get an ItemStack.

        The spec. is of the form "material-name[:data-byte][,amount][,glow]" where material-name is a valid Bukkit material name as understoood by Material.matchMaterial(String), data-byte is a numeric byte value, amount is an optional item quantity, and "glow" if present indicates that the item should glow if possible.

        No item metadata is considered by this method.

        Parameters:
        spec - the specification
        Returns:
        the return ItemStack
        Throws:
        me.desht.dhutils.DHUtilsException - if the specification is invalid

      • getFaceRotation

        public static int getFaceRotation(BlockFace face1,
                  BlockFace face2)
        Get the relative rotations of two block faces; the number of clockwise 90-degree rotations from the first face to the second.
        Parameters:
        face1 - the first face
        face2 - the second face
        Returns:
        the number of 90-degree rotations between the faces

      • getRotatedFace

        public static BlockFace getRotatedFace(BlockFace face,
                       int rotation)
        Given a BlockFace and a rotation in units of 90 degrees, return the face obtained by a clockwise rotation.
        Parameters:
        face - the original face
        rotation - number of clockwise 90-degree rotations
        Returns:
        the rotated face

        public static double getMaterialHardness(Material mat)

        Parameters:
        mat - the material to check
        Returns:
        the base hardness of the block
        See Also:
